| information can be expressed in U.S. dollars and in Salvadoran colÃ³n, but the
| colÃ³n is out of circulation. footnote_b = Telephone companies (market share):
| Tigo (45%), Claro (25%), Movistar (24%), Digicel (5.5%), Red (0.5%).


The colÃ³n was the official currency of El Salvador from 1892 to 2001, when it
adopted the U.S. Dollar.

In 2010 El Salvador ranked in the top 10 among Latin American countries in terms
of the Human Development Index and in the top 3 in Central America (behind Costa
Rica and Panama), due in part to ongoing rapid industrialization.
